paramInformation.label: Overload Protection
paramInformation.description: If current exceeds 11.5A over 5 seconds, relay will turn off.

paramInformation.label: Notification When Load Status Change
paramInformation.description: Smart plug can send notifications to association device (group lifeline) when state of smart plug’s load change

options.label: Send basic report only when load condition is not changed by Z-Wave command

paramInformation.label: Indicator Modes
paramInformation.description: After smart plug being included into a Z-Wave network, the RGB LED indicator will indicator the situation of load

options.label: The indicator light remains the same as the load on/off status. when the load is on, the light is on, and the off is off"
Within 5 seconds after the operation load, the indicator light is consistent with the load on/off status, and then the indicator is off

paramInformation.label: Threshold of Power Report
paramInformation.description: Power threshold to be interpreted, when the change value of load power exceeds the setting threshold, the smart plug will send meter report to association device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: Power Report Frequency
paramInformation.description: The interval of sending power report to association device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: Energy Report Frequency
paramInformation.description: The interval of sending energy report to association device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: Voltage Report Frequency
paramInformation.description: The interval of sending voltage report to association device (group lifeline)

paramInformation.label: Electricity Report Frequency
paramInformation.description: The interval of sending electricity report to association device (group lifeline)

metadata.inclusion:
Add for inclusion (non-security and security):
1)Connect the power supply.
2)Set the Z-Wave network main controller into learning mode.
3)Triple click the Z-button, the LED indicator will be flashing 3 times in Blue.
4)Smart Plug should be recognized and included into the Z-Wave network
metadata.exclusion:
1) Insert the Plug into a socket.
2) Set the Z-Wave network controller into the exclusion mode. 
3) Triple click the Z button.
4) LED will blink in blue for 3 times, and then start slow flashing to indicate that the remove for exclusion is successful. LED will indicate network status after it is removed from Z-Wave network
metadata.reset: Long press the button for 20 seconds and the blue LED will speed up the flash and then LED will keep on for 3 seconds in blue and Smart Plug will send ”Device Reset Locally Notification” to the main controller and exclude from the Z-Wave network, this procedure will reset Smart Plug to factory default. Please use this procedure only when the network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable.Please use this procedure only when the network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable
